article:
'' phosphofructokinase. .]] 'Enzyme activators' are molecules that bind to
enzymes and increase their activity. They are the opposite of enzyme inhibitors.
These molecules are often involved in the allosteric regulation of enzymes in
the control of metabolism. An example of an enzyme activator working in this way
is fructose 2,6-bisphosphate, which activates phosphofructokinase 1 and
increases the rate of glycolysis in response to the hormone
insulin.
